title: SCOOP: Sunny Deol, Aamir Khan and Rajinikanth to take on Hrithik Roshan and NTR Jr. on Independence Day - Bollywood Hungama
Rekhachithram Review | Alternate History Trope Keeps This Generic Thriller Afloat - Lensmen Reviews
summary:
Rekhachithram Review | Alternate History Trope Keeps This Generic Thriller Afloat

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 | Source: Lensmen Reviews

Rekhachithram, directed by Jofin T Chacko, attempts to leverage the alternate history genre to uplift a standard crime thriller but ends up being a passable film with notable compromises.

  • The film centers around a Kerala Police CI, Vivek Gopinath, who investigates a suicide linked to a missing person case from 1985.
  • It draws on elements from the 1985 film Kathodu Kathoram, which serves as a substantial backdrop.
  • The narrative lacks originality, delivering predictable twists and unexciting investigation beats.
  • The alternate history elements shine more than the primary narrative, offering some emotional depth to the female character.
  • Character performances, including Asif Ali and Anaswara Rajan, are competent but limited by the writing.
  • The film is filled with references and tributes to 1980s cinema legends, though execution varies in subtlety.
"With the effective inclusion of one or more real-life elements at the correct points, Rekhachithram is a passable thriller with evident compromises."

The movie aspires to blend real historical events with fiction but ultimately results in a standard thriller that may only please those with a keen interest in alternate histories.
newTitle: Rekhachithram Review: A Generic Thriller Enhanced by Alternate History

title: ‘It’s her foolishness': Sonu Sood says he is not on talking terms with ‘not a bad person’ Kangana Ranaut - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sonu Sood Addresses Fallout with Kangana Ranaut

Date: Jan 09, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

Sonu Sood has revealed that he is no longer in touch with Kangana Ranaut following their fallout over the film Manikarnika. Despite their past friendship, Sonu stated that they have not spoken since he left the project.

  • The feud between Sonu Sood and Kangana Ranaut dates back over five years.
  • Sonu walked out of Kangana's film Manikarnika in 2019, which led to a breakdown in their relationship.
  • Despite the fallout, Sonu maintains fond memories of their friendship and speaks highly of Kangana's family.
  • He described recent incidents where mutual friends attempted to reunite them but were unsuccessful.
“I feel that it’s her foolishness, she is not a bad person. But sometimes, when you write or say things, you don’t actually think it through.” - Sonu Sood

In conclusion, while Sonu acknowledges the challenges in their relationship, he seems to retain a degree of respect for Kangana, emphasizing that he prefers not to speak ill of her.
newTitle: Sonu Sood Addresses Fallout with Kangana Ranaut

Nora Fatehi shared her terrifying experience with Los Angeles wildfires, revealing she received an evacuation order just minutes before she had to leave. Priyanka Chopra also documented the crisis from her home.

  • Nora Fatehi recorded a video from her car showing the raging fires in LA.
  • She expressed her fear and discussed her plans to stay near the airport to catch her flight.
  • Priyanka Chopra posted videos of the wildfires burning near her home and expressed her concern for everyone's safety.
  • The wildfires have destroyed over 1,000 structures and forced over 130,000 residents to evacuate.
  • Notable figures from Hollywood have also been affected, with many forced to flee their homes.
“I'm in LA and the wildfires are crazy. I've never seen anything like this... So, I quickly packed all my stuff and I'm evacuating out of here...” - Nora Fatehi

The wildfires have resulted in significant destruction in Los Angeles, with potential long-term impacts on both residents and the entertainment industry.

title: Once bigger than Shah Rukh, Salman Khan, this star lost it all after 20 straight flops, was unable to pay medical bills - Hindustan Times
summary:
The Rise and Fall of Rahul Roy: From Stardom to Struggles

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Once a promising star in Bollywood, Rahul Roy's career fell into decline after a series of failures at the box office, leading him to face significant personal and financial struggles.

  • Debuted in 1990 with the hit film Aashiqui.
  • Achieved stardom but suffered a downfall with 20 consecutive flops.
  • Participated in reality shows and faced financial hardships.
  • Suffered a stroke and heart attack in 2020, requiring extensive medical treatment.
  • Received support from Salman Khan during his health crisis.
  • Made a comeback in 2023 in both acting and producing roles.
“I did not even have the money to foot my medical bills.” - Rahul Roy

Rahul Roy's journey reflects the unpredictable nature of fame in the entertainment industry, illustrating that even the brightest stars can face significant challenges.
newTitle: The Rise and Fall of Rahul Roy: From Stardom to Struggles

summary:
'Pushpa 2' worldwide box office collection day 35

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

After 35 days in theaters, Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa 2' has amassed an impressive worldwide box office collection of Rs 1,840 crores, which places it just Rs 230 crore short of dethroning Aamir Khan's 'Dangal'.

  • The film has made Rs 2.15 crore on day 35, bringing its total domestic collection to Rs 1213 crore.
  • 'Pushpa 2' has surpassed the box office collection of 'Baahubali 2', making it one of the highest-grossing films.
  • An extended version of the film will be released on January 17, but the release is delayed due to technical reasons.
  • Competition from Ram Charan's 'Game Changer' releasing on January 14 may affect 'Pushpa 2's screening availability.
'Pushpa 2' may face reduced screens, impacting its chances to surpass 'Dangal' as a new competitor arrives.

The race against time for 'Pushpa 2' continues as it endeavors to break through the remaining barriers for box office supremacy.
newTitle: 'Pushpa 2' Box Office Hits Rs 1831 Crore, Needs Rs 230 Crore More to Topple 'Dangal'

title: Payal Kapadia secures nomination at Directors Guild of America Awards after Golden Globes snub - Hindustan Times
summary:
Payal Kapadia Nominated for DGA Award Following Golden Globes Snub

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Payal Kapadia has received a nomination for the Directors Guild of America (DGA) award in the first-time director category for her film debut, All We Imagine As Light, just days after not winning at the Golden Globes.

  • The DGA announced the nominations on January 9, 2025.
  • Kapadia's film explores themes of love, longing, and loneliness among three women in Mumbai.
  • Other nominees in the same category include Megan Park, RaMell Ross, Halfdan Ullmann Tondel, and Sean Wang.
  • All We Imagine As Light won the Grand Prix award at the 2024 Cannes Film Festival, marking it as the first Indian film to win this award.
  • Kapadia was recently named Best Director by The National Society of Film Critics (NSFC) in New York.
"We didn't win but..." - Payal Kapadia reflecting on her Golden Globes experience.

This nomination is a significant recognition of Kapadia's talent as a first-time feature film director in the competitive landscape of international cinema.
newTitle: Payal Kapadia Nominated for DGA Award Following Golden Globes Snub

title: Los Angeles wildfire LIVE Updates: 5 dead, ‘Sunset Fire’ in Hollywood Hills grows to 50 acres, Biden cancels Italy trip | Today News - Mint
summary:
Los Angeles wildfire LIVE Updates: 5 dead, ‘Sunset Fire’ in Hollywood Hills grows to 50 acres, Biden cancels Italy trip

Date: 09 Jan 2025 Source: LiveMint

Firefighters in Los Angeles are grappling with an out-of-control wildfire that has claimed five lives and forced a mass evacuation of 100,000 residents, including numerous celebrities.

  • The fire has destroyed multimillion-dollar homes and affected approximately 100,000 residents in the surrounding areas.
  • California Governor Gavin Newsom expressed gratitude for the efforts of firefighters managing the crisis.
  • President Joe Biden canceled his trip to Italy to focus on addressing the wildfires in California.
  • SpaceX is providing free Starlink terminals to areas affected by the fires, aiding communication for residents.
  • The Eaton Fire has grown to 10,600 acres, causing significant destruction and prompting widespread evacuations.
  • Authorities urged residents to stay indoors due to dangerous air quality caused by the smoke.
“The President’s action makes Federal funding available to affected individuals in Los Angeles County.” - White House Statement

This wildfire event highlights the ongoing challenges of wildfire management in California, compounded by extreme weather conditions.
newTitle: Los Angeles Wildfire: 5 Dead as Sunset Fire Grows to 50 Acres

title: After Guneet Monga, Priyanka Chopra joins Oscar-shortlisted short film Anuja as executive producer: ‘Extremely proud’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Chopra Joins Oscar-Shortlisted Film Anuja as Executive Producer

Date: Jan 09, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Global star Priyanka Chopra is extremely happy as she has come on board as an executive producer for the Oscar-shortlisted film Anuja. This film centers on a nine-year-old girl working in a garment factory who faces life-changing decisions.

  • Priyanka Chopra is proud to join the film Anuja as an executive producer.
  • The film is produced in collaboration with Salaam Baalak Trust, Shine Global, and Krushan Naik Films.
  • Guneet Monga, known for her Oscar-winning projects, is also a producer on Anuja.
  • Anuja depicts the struggles of children in tough circumstances, highlighting important social issues.
“This beautiful film shines a spotlight on a subject that affects millions of children around the world, who are faced with the impossible decision between a future they cannot yet see and the immediate realities of their present.” - Priyanka Chopra

Priyanka's involvement emphasizes her commitment to impactful storytelling in cinema, aiming to create awareness about significant social issues.
newTitle: Priyanka Chopra Joins Oscar-Shortlisted Film Anuja as Executive Producer

title: Nagarjuna Akkineni reveals his fitness mantra for a strong physique at 65: 'I finish my dinner by 7 pm or - TOI Etimes
summary:
Nagarjuna Akkineni Shares Fitness Tips for a Strong Physique at 65

Publication Date: Not specifiedSource: HT Lifestyle

Nagarjuna Akkineni is set to celebrate his 66th birthday this year and has shared his fitness secrets that help him maintain a strong physique.

  • Nagarjuna works out 5 to 6 days a week for about an hour each morning.
  • He incorporates swimming and golf into his routine for mental and physical well-being.
  • The actor practises a mix of cardio and strength training, believing in consistency for over 30 years.
  • He emphasizes the importance of maintaining a heart rate above 70% during workouts.
  • Nagarjuna finishes his dinner by 7 pm or 7:30 pm, adapting his diet as he ages.
  • He follows a 12:12 intermittent fasting routine and enjoys cheat meals on Sundays.
  • Golf and swimming contribute significantly to his mental clarity and overall fitness.
“I finish my dinner by 7 pm or 7:30 pm at the latest. This habit sets your diet and lifestyle on the right track.”

Nagarjuna's commitment to fitness at 65 serves as an inspiration, highlighting the balance between physical activity and a healthy diet for overall well-being.
newTitle: Nagarjuna Akkineni Shares Fitness Tips for a Strong Physique at 65

title: Game Changer Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking (1 Day To Go): Sells 5 Lakh Tickets Already But Will Fail To Beat Guntur Kaaram - Koimoi
summary:
Game Changer Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking (1 Day To Go)

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Koimoi

The countdown is set to end as we’re just one day away from Ram Charan’s Game Changer. The advance booking response, however, is underwhelming compared to expectations.

  • The film has sold over 5 lakh tickets for day 1.
  • Advance booking gross stands at 14.83 crore.
  • Andhra Pradesh leads in ticket sales, followed by Telangana and Karnataka.
  • High expectations were set due to the collaboration of Shankar and Ram Charan, but responses have been muted.
  • The film is expected to hit around 20 crore by end of day, but comparisons to Mahesh Babu’s Guntur Kaaram reveal that it may fall short.
“From here, it will definitely fail to beat Mahesh Babu’s Guntur Kaaram, which sold tickets worth 24.90 crore gross at the Indian box office for day 1.”

Overall, while the advance booking numbers are decent, they fall short of the major expectations set for this blockbuster film.
newTitle: Game Changer Box Office Day 1 Advance Booking Shows Mixed Results

title: Kangana Ranaut says it was a mistake directing Emergency, choosing theatrical release: 'Thought I'd be able to get away' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kangana Ranaut Reflects on Mistakes in Directing Emergency

Date: Jan 09, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Kangana Ranaut shares her thoughts on the delays and challenges surrounding her directorial debut, Emergency, revealing her regrets over certain decisions.

  • The film is set to release in theaters on January 17 after facing delays due to certification issues.
  • Kangana expressed her fear over the CBFC's refusal to certify the film for months.
  • She regretted choosing a theatrical release, believing it would have been better suited for OTT platforms.
  • The film stars Kangana as Indira Gandhi and addresses significant historical events.
“I felt that it was a wrong decision to release it in theatres. I thought I could have gotten a better deal on OTT.” - Kangana Ranaut

Ultimately, Kangana reflects on the challenges of filmmaking and the complexities of addressing historical narratives.
newTitle: Kangana Ranaut Reflects on Mistakes in Directing Emergency

title: Paris Hilton 'heartbroken' as she watches her Malibu home burn on live TV - Moneycontrol
summary:
Paris Hilton 'heartbroken' as she watches her Malibu home burn on live TV

Date: January 09, 2025 / 09:14 IST Source: Moneycontrol

Paris Hilton was heartbroken as she shared video of her family home in Malibu being completely destroyed in the Los Angeles wildfires.

  • Hilton shared an emotional Instagram post about the loss.
  • She expressed that she was 'heartbroken beyond words' over the incident.
  • Her home was a place filled with precious memories, including significant moments with her family.
"Heartbroken beyond words. Sitting with my family, watching the news, and seeing our home in Malibu burn to the ground on live TV is something no one should ever have to experience. This home was where we built so many precious memories. It’s where Phoenix took his first steps and where we dreamed of building a lifetime of memories with London."

This tragic event highlights the devastating impact of wildfires on individuals and families, showcasing the emotional toll it takes to lose a cherished home.
newTitle: Paris Hilton 'heartbroken' as she watches her Malibu home burn on live TV
